About "Before tackling new features let's make the basics simple".

While I agree with most of the rest that was said I reacted negatively in
the beginning to that statement in the context of Lambdas "I'm in shock,
you're discussing how to use Lambda's well when some of the basic elements
are hard to use correctly". It is simply a false dichotomy. It is not a
matter of "we should be doing this rather than that".

In my experience Lambdas are a key to a great deal of simplicity. It's not
really a new feature in the sense "we can do new stuff" as it is "we can do
stuff differently". Looking at lambdas certainly doesn't prevent fixing
other things. More than anything from this discussion, when looking at
JUnit5 in the light of java 1.8, one of the things that should be solved in
"core" is categories (it seems).
